description: From the French littérateur, from the Latin litterātor (“critic”). Doublet of literator.

nouns.description: litterateur (plural litterateurs, feminine litterateuse or litteratrice)

entries.meaning: A person engaged in various literary works: literary critic, essayist, writer.
examples: Lucius Annaeus Seneca, the Roman philosopher, playwright and littérateur, was the boyhood tutor of the emperor Nero, and later on his adviser.
